comments.body: no ellos al momento de hacer cierta cantidad de intercambios específicos dar una mata del tesoro o dar rumores sobre los monstruos y sus debilidades.
Should trade nitwit viiagers so you can repopulate a dead village or one you create.

It appears there is either already an existing thread on this topic (or something very similar), it's a list of items/mobs/ideas, contains a previously rejected idea, is a bug or support issue, exists, or it is too general/contains no actionable suggestions, and is being removed by our team.  Please check out this link (https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360004442111-Creating-Great-Ideas), and be sure to join existing threads in progress (we read ALL the comments). Thanks!
What?
What undead dimension?
Cool idea, but I would like to know what the undead dimension is. The Nether???
Also works if you wear a Zombie/Skeleton skin on Minecraft Bedrock, (discovered this years ago.)

Thanks for your contribution.
They don't know how to because their brains are completely rotten.
This makes no sense I'm sorry to say. The Illusioner is an unused mob so it makes sense why there's only one wizard in the survival game.
Where did you mention End Outposts? Why in the End Cities? How did he even get there when the portal isn't even activated?
This makes no sense at all. I apologize.
maybe there are multiple ways to access the end, the poral is just the easiest.
I'm sry but this makes no sense and I don't feel like this is one of your best thoughts.

if you don't get it, its basically:

some kind of wandering mob that can be paid to summon rain, (like if you need it for your crops or whatever)

He also sells a thunder staff, which is like a bow for thunder charges, which can fly about as far as and ender pearl could, and then summons down lightning on the impact spot

Thanks for your contribution.
Too late
This would be a good idea but,what if Mojang adds new harmful potions.
Witches are hostile now.
The Lost Scrap Block could in rare instances give a scrap armor trim when brushed

Axolotls can play dead to heal so what if potentially undead could fall onto the ground when they take enough physical damage to die they won't fully die unless their damaged by something that will kill them, but they don't regenerate like axolotls, so they're just crawling around on the ground or immobilized but still there to attack.
maybe other zombies could even climb onto the immobilized zombies to get higher up, and climb over a fortress wall.

Also to balance this out maybe skeleton can become bowless when they run out of arrows and then they have to punch only just like zombies.
if all skeletons only have 64 arrows to shoot, unless they pick up more or the same arrows they shot.

iron golems attack Undead but they don't deal the right kind of damage so what if iron golems could be enchanted with Smite, fire aspect.
maybe the book it could just be clicked but that doesn't make any sense. carved pumpkins can already be enchanted with curses like cursive binding so if they were enchanted with Smite and fire aspect enchantments then the pumpkin would spawn an iron golem that can deal that to type of damage.
this would potentially also allow for snow golems to be created with flame so they can shoot flaming snowballs lol.
or they can just get destroyed by the undead with this game rule on because they can only knock them back.

I had the builder idea but you went further with it! Great ideas. Though, I wouldn’t have a block that manages villagers. Rather, I’d make it ultra rare to find armor for a villager profession. Each piece adding to their efficiency. Blueprints being made with bulk items or rarely found in villages. Though I think it would be fair to make it harder by only using master villagers. Maybe even add a new villager experience tier requiring you to buy AND sell to them a lot. Trading Halls are close to slavery. Let’s give them some good faith and make us earn their commitment before they hit the fields.
Make side effects if wore too long. Like holding breath underwater. Except slowness, fire damage, etc,. Or make the durability fairly short.
Give me lore!
Only 2 wizards in 1 world. Good and Evil.
The villager who upgrades the village over time is you! :)
They considered female villagers already, and ruled them out forever. Villagers are humanoids, not humans.
oh... I didn't know that... :'(

Can’t say I agree. I like to go shopping around various villages for the best deals.

Give your villagers names and you’ll keep track of who’s doing sales better
The creeper is perfect and will NEVER be removed. Also there are other ways to obtain gunpowder already and with the new spear killing a creeper is easier than it ever was
Honestly though, do you really want a creeper blowing up your builds?
This will make the trading life lively and prevent the game to become dull and lame when it comes to late game. At least, our stuffs we don't need anymore has a use to NITWIT'S!

We all know that Nitwit is a jobless villager, but at least they will fit on a type of villager who spent money for their needs and wants.

They are the embodiment of people that benefits from financial supports of their parents or partners. Or maybe they are royal blood who ruled the village etc...

I mentioned on my suggestions about their levels, Level 1 as Commoner Nitwit; Level 2 as Middle Class Nitwit; Level 3 as Elite Nitwit and; Level 4 as Royal Blood Nitwit.

Each level has different demands. I call it demands since they only buy goods and items, they do not sell anything to call them traders, rather they are called CONSUMERS.
Level 1 can buy common goods such as cooked foods etc... Level 3 can buy poisonous potato, we all know Elites has some fishy stuff.
Blah, blah blah up to Level 4 Royal Blood that buys luxurious items such as rare mobs in a bucket, used netherite armors and weapons etc...

Kindly VOTE my idea, thank you!

Luv lots!

The variant undead mobs like husks and drowns can just be a different effect because they're turned when something happens to them like drowning in the water, drying out in the desert, and freezing in powdered snow.
also the zombies shouldn't have partial effects because zombies already don't unless they're being cured.

also if they added quicksand maybe it would be the way husks could be made.
like with powdered snow and skeletons turning into strays.
Using a totem of undying should turn players into undead mode, to balance how op totems are by making it a one time thing until you get cured.

Timothy, I agree. The kids was just a suggestion. They would be different sizes, so you could have "kids running around"

 

Yes, this will be for all Minecraft.

We should at least be able to find NPCs that have skin varieties (because villagers all look the same, besides their clothing) as passive/neutral mobs. If we cannot customize them then we should at least be able to put armor on them. They would be useful for people who make cities or towns much larger than villages; a way to populate them.
Don’t they already exist?
It would be good for map-making for Minecraft servers like Hypixel

Espero que se pueda en Minecraft, es difícil crear por tutoriales de YouTube.. muchos comandos y mods que no se puede descargar por teléfonos y otros aparatos electrónicos. Solo que se usará en modo creativo el comando /npc @e y que da un huevo, el npc estará en blanco y lo podrás editar dándole click a "editar" habrá tres ediciones: Skin, acción y efectos.

Yes this is agood idea do it please

Miinecraft
man that is COOOOOOOOOOOOL
Who here wants to add passive sharks???????

Sounds great and all but why does everything have to be so passive? Can't we make NPCs that can be neutral, friendly, or aggressive towards player depending on the ai and of course have them defend themselves from mobs

I just wanna say I really hope they take inspiration from the custom NPCs mod, you can do ten times this stuff and more including making your own custom bosses , trade system, set a list to who the NPC can attack , animations (they already added ) have them use custom lines written by the player . Set them to behave as neutral, passive, friendly or aggressive. And the list goes on . This might just be a dream come true, let's keep the ideas going Minecraft community !

I think that having it naturally spawn would be too much, imagine a new player coming across it by chance, they wouldn't stand a chance. I think this is a great idea though, maybe the Wardens can have drops that could be used to summon it, kinda like how you spawn the wither, or maybe like other boss mobs in Terraria, where you'd use it once and it summons the boss
We already get 2 shoted as it is and I don't think they will be adding new armor any time soon
It would be cool if you had to do a ritual to summon it from "The Void". I like this idea, though, but like someone said, having it spawn naturally would be a bit much.

Maybe not a boos bar. But it could be slightly bigger maybe even give it a different color like red. Of course what it could possibly do it make a noise that causes other wardens to run away from it, and hide. They would be afraid of it, and if it heard any of the noise it would attack them. Which is also why if it got to close to there hiding place they would find a new one. However the same would go for the player. Another difference with this warden may also be however it would use echo location at random points to send out vibrations to detect things including the player. In this scenario if the player is to close or not behind something it would slowly make it's way to the player.
The warden is already OP enough imo, so it'd be best if this was just a summonable boss (like withers) rather than a rare spawn.
A rare spawn means u could have two of them so something like the Ender dragon it has a place where u can fight it and spawn it again

A. Why do you talk in ALL CAPS.

B. That is a terrible idea the normal warden is a boss in itself.
Too powerful. The warden we have right now does sooooooooo much damage, and the Alpha would one shot anything.

This just aggravates me like as a player of minecraft this will RUIN the game its like adding natural roaming AK 47’s around minecraft and also the warden by itself is to powerful (probably going to nerf it) so no this is a bad idea
You had caps on buddy
The Warden is already a god-tier mob. Lol

Sorry, but I don't agree with your idea as the warden is already a netherite-armored-player-destroyer. First, there is no point in creating a boss mob if there is no reward for killing it. Secondly, Mojang has stated that they want people to avoid the warden, not kill it. That is why they created the Warden in the 1st place. The Alpha Warden defeats those intentions.
I think the right way is summoning this boss on a special place of deep dark with a special and rare warden drop

The regular warden is already supposed to be super powerful, so having an even more powerful version would ruin the immersion. It would also be pointless since the warden isn't supposed to be fought anyway.
I feel like this thing would be too OP for vanilla Minecraft. That's what mods are for.
Wardens are already so tough and why did you have to type this in caps?

Yeah, I think you should have to spawn it. Maybe a wither shape but skulk blocks instead and skulk shriekers as the "Heads".

But otherwise, I would say maybe.

Cool idea, tho it would be too overpowered if it naturally spawned. So I suggest that it should spawn in a new dimension  which can be entered when all the sculk blocks of an ancient city get destroyed, making the portal thing light up. When entering, you find a massive palace filled with monsters and some wardens on the floors and in the top floor of the palace, there would be the alpha warden.
